intro: Hedypnois glabra, commonly known as the smooth hedypnois, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers, which are arranged in dense inflorescences. Hedypnois glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
